text: Yahweh Blesses Chosen Israel
“But now hear, Jacob my servant,
and Israel, whom I have chosen.
Thus says Yahweh, who made you,
and who formed you in\f + \fr 44:2 \ft Or “from” \f* \add the\add* womb and will help you:
you must not fear, my servant Jacob,
and Jeshurun whom I have chosen.
For I will pour out water on a thirsty \add land\add*
and streams on dry ground.
I will pour my spirit out on your descendants\f + \fr 44:3 \ft Hebrew “descendant” \f*
and my blessing on your offspring.
And they shall sprout ⸤among⸥\f + \fr 44:4 \ft Literally “in between” \f* \add the\add* grass
like willows by a watercourse of water.
This \add one\add* will say, ‘I belong to Yahweh!’
And that \add one\add* will be called by the name of Jacob,
and another will write \add on\add* his hand ‘Yahweh’s’
and ⸤take the name⸥\f + \fr 44:5 \ft Literally “he will be titled by the name” \f* of Israel.”
Yahweh the Only God
Thus says Yahweh, the king of Israel,
and its redeemer, Yahweh of hosts:
“I \add am the\add* first, and I \add am the\add* last,
and there is no god besides me.
And who \add is\add* like me? Let him proclaim\f + \fr 44:7 \ft Or “call” \f* \add it\add*!
And let him declare it and set it in order for me
⸤since I established an eternal people⸥\f + \fr 44:7 \ft Literally “from my placing a people of eternity” \f* and things that are to come,
and let them tell them \add the things\add* that are coming.
You must not tremble,\f + \fr 44:8 \ft Or “be startled” \f*
and you must not be paralyzed with fear.
Have I not made you hear from of old\f + \fr 44:8 \ft Or “then” \f*
and declared \add it\add*, and you \add are\add* my witnesses?
Is there a god besides me?
And there is no rock! I know none!”
Idolatry Is Ridiculous
All those who form an idol \add are\add* nothing,
and their delightful things do not profit.
And their witnesses do not see or know,
so they will be ashamed.
Who would form a god
and cast an image of \add which\add* he cannot profit?
Look! all his companions shall be ashamed,
and \add the\add* artisans \add are\add* human!
Let all of them assemble;
let them stand up.
They shall tremble;\f + \fr 44:11 \ft Or “be startled” \f*
they shall be ashamed together.
\add The\add* ⸤ironsmith⸥\f + \fr 44:12 \ft Literally “craftsman of iron” \f* works in the coals \add with his\add* tool
and forms it with hammers.
And he makes it with ⸤his strong arm⸥;\f + \fr 44:12 \ft Literally “the arm of his strength” \f*
indeed, he becomes hungry, and ⸤he lacks⸥\f + \fr 44:12 \ft Literally “there is no” \f* strength;
he does not drink water, and he is faint.
\add The\add* ⸤woodworker⸥\f + \fr 44:13 \ft Literally “craftsman of wood” \f* stretches out a line;
he makes an outline \add of\add* it with \add a\add* marker.
He makes it with \add a\add* knife
and makes an outline \add of\add* it with \add a\add* compass.
He makes it like \add the\add* image of a man,
like \add the\add* beauty of a human, to dwell \add in\add* a temple.\f + \fr 44:13 \ft Or “house” \f*
Cutting down cedars for himself,
he ⸤chooses⸥\f + \fr 44:14 \ft Literally “takes” \f* a holm tree and an oak,
and he lets it grow strong for him among \add the\add* trees of \add the\add* forest.
He plants a cedar, and \add the\add* rain makes \add it\add* grow.
And it ⸤becomes fuel for a human⸥,\f + \fr 44:15 \ft Literally “will become for a man as burning” \f*
and he takes some of it and grows warm;
also, he kindles a fire and bakes bread.
Also, he makes a god and bows in worship;
he makes himself an image and bows down to it!
He burns half of it in \add the\add* fire;
he eats meat over half of it;
he roasts a roast and is satisfied.
Also he grows warm and says, “Ah!
I am warm! I see \add the\add* fire!”
And he makes the remainder of it into a god!
He bows down to his idol,
and he bows in worship and prays to him,
and he says, “Save me, for you \add are\add* my god!”
They do not know,
and they do not understand,
for their eyes \add are\add* besmeared ⸤so that they cannot see⸥,\f + \fr 44:18 \ft Literally “from seeing” \f*
their ⸤minds⸥\f + \fr 44:18 \ft Literally “hearts” \f* ⸤so that they have no insight⸥.\f + \fr 44:18 \ft Literally “from having insight” \f*
And ⸤no one takes it to heart⸥,\f + \fr 44:19 \ft Literally “he does not bring back to his heart” \f* and \add there is\add* no knowledge
and no understanding to say, “I burned half of it in \add the\add* fire
and also I baked bread on its coals;
I roasted meat, and I have eaten.
And I shall make \add the\add* rest of it into an abomination!
I shall bow down to a block of wood!”
\add He\add* feeds \add on\add* ashes; a ⸤deceived mind⸥\f + \fr 44:20 \ft Literally “heart deceived” \f* misleads him.
And he cannot save ⸤himself⸥,\f + \fr 44:20 \ft Literally “his soul” \f* and he cannot say,
“Is \add this\add* not an illusion in my right hand?”
Yahweh Remembers Israel
“Remember these things, Jacob,
and Israel, for you \add are\add* my servant:
I formed you; you \add are\add* my servant;
Israel, you will not be forgotten by me!
I have wiped your transgressions out like \add a\add* cloud
and your sins like mist.
Return to me,
for I have redeemed you!”
Sing for joy, heavens, for Yahweh has done \add it\add*!
Shout, depths of \add the\add* earth!
Break forth, mountains, \add in\add* rejoicing,
forest and every tree in it,
for Yahweh has redeemed Jacob,
and he will show his glory in Israel!
Jerusalem Restored through Cyrus
Thus says Yahweh, your redeemer,
and he who formed you in\f + \fr 44:24 \ft Or “from” \f* \add the\add* womb:
“I \add am\add* Yahweh, who made everything,
who stretched out \add the\add* heavens alone,
who spread out the earth—who \add was\add* with me?—
who frustrates\f + \fr 44:25 \ft Or “breaks” \f* \add the\add* signs of oracle priests
and makes a fool of diviners,
who drives \add the\add* wise men back
and makes their knowledge foolish,
who keeps\f + \fr 44:26 \ft Or “erects” \f* the word of his servant
and carries out the plan of his messengers,
who says of Jerusalem, ‘It shall be inhabited,’
and of the cities of Judah, ‘They shall be rebuilt,
and I will restore its ruins’;
who says to the deep, ‘Dry up!
And I will cause your rivers to dry up’;
who says of Cyrus, ‘My shepherd,’
and he shall carry out all my wishes\f + \fr 44:28 \ft Hebrew “wish” \f*;
and saying of Jerusalem, ‘It shall be rebuilt,’
and \add the\add* temple, ‘It shall be founded.’ ”
